pull_requests.title: Add locktime threshold definition to BIP65
pull_requests.body: I don't believe it is defined, just referenced as a c++ value `LOCKTIME_THRESHOLD`.

comment_list.body: Pre-BIP consensus rules are defined in the code, and usually not referenced and assumed to be known (e.g. some BIPs use the concept of compact size without explaining it). You can't really "define" the locktime threshold here, as it has already been defined (in this case in Bitcoin v0.1). What this really adds is a clarification, and as such (if it's needed at all) it probably belongs in a footnote.

NACK

The definition is the C++ codebase. The textual summary is just a summary and can't be relied on for precise semantics; leaving out the `LOCKTIME_THRESHOLD` definition correctly points readers in that direction.
Thank you @Christewart for the proposal. Closing for now per BIP author NACK.
